name: moralistically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a moralistic way (= that judges people and tries to make them behave according to standards of right and wrong that never change and may be too severe or unfair): He talked rather moralistically about family breakdown. Rather than moralistically lecturing people, we should try to help them.
More examplesFewer examplesI am not making this point moralistically, but just making an observation.He wrote moralistically about the culture in which he lived.The whole book is rather moralistically serious.Some people are quick to moralistically condemn the consumerism of poorer people.
